intro: Periphanes gemmata, commonly known as the gemmed periphanes, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is often found in woodland edges and rocky habitats, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its environment. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for studies on plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
